description.narrative: The purpose of this project is to support implementation of the New partnership for Somalia and National Development Plan through strengthening national capacities for effective aid management and coordination.

participating-org.narrative: UNITED STATES AGENCY FOR INTERNATIONAL DEVELOPMENT (USAID)

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

provider-org.narrative: UNITED STATES AGENCY FOR INTERNATIONAL DEVELOPMENT (USAID)
UNITED STATES AGENCY FOR INTERNATIONAL DEVELOPMENT (USAID)
UNITED STATES AGENCY FOR INTERNATIONAL DEVELOPMENT (USAID)

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).
UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

description.narrative: Activity 1: Somalia Development and Reconstruction Facility coordination meetings satisfactorily organised Activity 2: Ministry of Planning Investments and Economic Development and Aid Coordination Unit have the capabilities to monitor New Partnership for Somalia (NPS) Implementation Activity 3: Project requires strong implementation systems and procedures.

comment.narrative: Activity 1: 1) No data; 2) All minutes have minutes made; 3) 8 Pillar Working Groups (PWG) have annual work plans; 4) PWGs report progress of implementation of prioritized actions; 5) No data on rating of satisfaction of trained beneficiaries in the last year; 6) Non existence of Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) on aid effectiveness; 7) No comprehensive Guidance Packages associated to aid effectiveness SOPs in place Activity 2: 1) Mutual Accountability Framework (MAF), aid flows and Use of Country Systems (as part of MAF) Progress Reports developed annually; 2) No Aid Information Management System in place Activity 3: 1) Number of project board meetings per year; 2) Number of progress reports produced per year

1) Less than 5% of the meetings are rescheduled; 2) All meetings have minutes made; 3) All PWGs have annual work plans; 4) All PWGs have annual report; 5) At least 4 training activities are organised and satisfactory rated after training by participants; 6) At least 4 Standard Operating Procedures are documented with clear role and responsibility distribution; 7) Comprehensive Guidance package is available

10 PWG meetings held 2 SDRF meetings conducted Aid Architecture review launched Somalia Partnership Forum held AIMS system developed MAF priorities for 2019-2020 developed Somali Aid flow for 2019 disseminated

OUTPUT 1: Strengthened Effectiveness and Coordination through the SDRF Aid Architecture
PWG core group members briefed on SDRF Operations manual once a year
All PWGs that comply with agreed minimal requirements for effective and strategic-focused management
Increased percentage of SDRF SC meetings comply with agreed core requirements for effective management and strategic focus
Each FMS report back on challenges and progress made against components of PWGs AWPs which are relevant for them at least twice a year
Somali Partnership Forum is organized twice a year in a successful manner
OUTPUT 2: Monitoring NPS, MAF, UCS implementation At least 1 aid coordination workshop organized per year in line with need 2 MAF progress reports produced reported per year At least 1 annual progress report produced for aid flows per year

OUTPUT 1: Strengthened Effectiveness and Coordination through the SDRF Aid Architecture
Frequency of briefings to PWG core group members on the SDRF Operations manual Number of PWGs that comply with agreed minimal requirements for effective and strategic-focused management
Number of SDRF SC meetings that comply with agreed core requirements for effective management and strategic focus Issues relevant to FMS are increasingly considered in the SDRF Somali Partnership Forum organized regularly in a successful manner
OUTPUT 2: Monitoring NPS, MAF, UCS implementation MOPIED and ACU have the capabilities to monitor NPS implementation
Progress on MAF implementation regularly monitored and reported Aid flows analysed and reported regularly
